intro: Palicourea angustiflora, commonly known as narrow-leaved palicourea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in terminal inflorescences. While not widely cultivated for ornamental purposes, it has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties.
